TopicTitle: Hanson Kerman's Sandbox Micro Missions (image heavy!)

Articles.Content:
Hi peeps!!

I'm HansonKerman, and these are my Sandbox Micro Missions where I post small missions in a new save!

This save is

Custom Mode - Normal Mode with 64% reentry heat

Oh, and VAB snippets will appear.

Notable mods:

Astronomers Visual Pack

Fengist's Font Factory

Kerbal Engineer Redux

MechJeb

MissingHistory

Textures Unlimited

RealPlume Stock

ManueverNodeEvolved

Everything Is Awesome (LEGO parts)

Squiggsy Space Research (probe parts)

and many, many, many, MANY, more...

Thanks to:

@SiriusRocketry, mission status report inspiration

@Triop, inspiration general

@All my forum friends (you know who you are)

 

Table of Contents

M1 - PPP1 - Construction Phase

M1 - PPP1 - Flight Phase

M2 - PPP2 "TTA" - Konstrucktion

M2 - PPP2 "TTA" - Flight Part One

M2 - PPP2 - "TTA" - Flight Part Two

M3 - EX1 - Konstruction

Mission One - Probey Probe Probe I

Construction

We use a few mods and make a decent payload.

 

Mandatory MechJeb and KER

 

Cute engines and TweakScaled panels

Now we do some fair farings and our friendly neighborhood first stage.

And we place our beautiful final stage onto our Probey Probe Probe I.

 

Later we'll see how she flies!

(Question: What gender do you call a Lego?)

Edited October 6, 2018 by HansonKerman

Looks good!

Answer to your question: I stepped on the Lego and kicked it out the window, so it doesn't matter

@SiriusRocketry :p It was a joke, since the probe core is from the Everything Is Awesome mod (no Forum thread, find it on SpaceDock), which adds Lego-themed parts.

Also I've made some edits to the craft

Mission One - Probey Probe Probe I

Flight

And after a few edits, we LAUNCH!

 

Look down at that receding LaunchPad!

Fly and see the clouds!

 

Booster sep. Thank you, SpaceY!

Like a dart in the clouds!

First Stage Sep

I'm pretty sure we won't be going to space today. (look at ap. hight)

Poor little probe...

A breath of thin air before atmo reentry.

Past apoapsis...

Down onto Kerbin ground... *sniff*

No pics of da boom, sry.

(There was no boom at 10x PhysWarp)

FAILURE

Edited September 24, 2018 by HansonKerman

Mission Two - Probey Probe Probe II

Construction Phase

Woot!

If at first you don't succeed, try, try, again.

Ah, yes. SO! Make the payload.

All good probes need a flexible battery. So, procedural parts!

(the battery is the circle inside the thingy)

I have forgetting issues. But why an antenna? *sigh* 

All rockets will need a first stage!

And a faring for awesome  probes!

(I wonder what the Kerbals think of that decoupler floating in the air. Bob, did you mix the red food coloring with the translucent levitation potion?!)

Nice TWR! MOAR BOOM!!

Eh, to be safe let's put on a little EVEN MOAR BOOM!! (1.875, coolness!)

Highlighted are awesome sepatrons!

For a very clean booster sep.

And let's make the boosters its own stage. (it has 2.something TWR even without the second stage)

Woo! Let's celebrate @Fengist for making the Fengist Font Factory Mod!

Finally, let's add some STYLE!

Tune in next time for the flight!

Mission Two - Probey Probe Probe II "Try Try Again"

Flight Phase Part One

Our majestic probe sits on the LaunchPad.

We begin.

And since boosters have no gimbal and I forgot fins, we travel in a straight line up for a while.

But stage sep comes soon.

Going up!

We're going to orbit! Look at dem stats!   (Ap. Height 55,452m and half a tank of LF)

We go to orbit.

Orbit insertion is soon!

(ok I apparently forgot to take a screenie of the next phase... we got into orbit, but we still had the FIRST stage...)

Mission Two - Probey Probe Probe II "Try, Try Again" 

Flight part 2

"No, We Are Not Going to The Mun."

And that's why. We have plenty of extra fuel though... We're winging it. Or... finning it  

Let's have some fun.

Let's go!

Hey, I got no time for math.

Okay, something went wrong, but luckily I ejected the first stage. Map looks like this: (yeah, I know, I'll give a proper screenie later)

After a bit, I make a new KER window:

With a big acronym:

The little rocket that could: (although engine works too)

Oh, and I made some edits to the ORBITAL panel 

Aww, bye-bye second stage!

Our sat:

And the finishing touch: the entirely aesthetic antenna

The battery looks kinda weird though

ABOVE AND BEYOND

Edited September 24, 2018 by HansonKerman

We're taking a break from the Probey Probe Probe line after Try, Try Again's Above and Beyond status sucess.

Mission Three - Extension Cord 1

Konstruction

The Extension Cord line will be... RELAYS!

The SSTU mod comes in handy for the probe.

Let's make the whole payload. (BOB! STOP MESSING WITH THE POTIONS!)

A nice second stage. (BOB, YOU KNOW YOU CAN GET FIRED!!)

Oh-oh! Our rocket's too big!

KVV to the rescue!

Our (yes, I consider you part of the team, without you you wouldn't be reading this mission report! That would be sad.) rocket has nice stats, if I do say so myself!

@HansonKerman these are cool! This thread seems like a similar idea to my own mission report thread, lol.

Also....do I count as one of your forum friends?
Hey, we all seem to have started mission report threads around the same time! @HansonKerman following this!

On 9/25/2018 at 3:58 PM, RealKerbal3x said:


thread seems like a similar idea to my own mission report thread, lol.Also....do I count as one of your forum friends? 

Yes of course!

OH, and sorry peeps I haven't been around much... I've been too immersed in Pokémon White 2

Spoiler

I. HATE. NIMBASA. CITY.

Mission Two - EX1

Flight Part One

Oh, No, Another Two-Part Flight!?

Yes, Jeb, here's why.

3-2-1-GO.

(for proper effect say that super quick)

STEEEEEEEEPPPP!

 

YAHHHOOOO!! (I really need to get a Hullcam on someadese rockets)

Oh BTW:  no-one uses either ARP or stock RP (A = Alternate RP = resource panel)  why

AAAANNNNYYYWHO...

 

Booster separation

Where's the AC?

Stage sep.

Alright, since I stupidly forgot to take the rest of the pics, suffice to say the probe will have an ABOVE AND BEYOND class mission output.

 

 

Edited October 6, 2018 by HansonKerman

Shiny R7-Titan thing. Nice

@RealKerbal3x The shine is from the Textures Unlimited Stock Config Model on SpaceDock (requires Textures Unlimited)

And for the Sputnik R-7, I looked on Wikipedia. The actual R-7 was a lot shorter: see here 

The whole shebang is just for looks. It probably has MUCH more rocket than needed.

Edited October 6, 2018 by HansonKerman

2 hours ago, HansonKerman said:

@RealKerbal3x The shine is from the Textures Unlimited Stock Config Model on SpaceDock (requires Textures Unlimited)

And for the Sputnik R-7, I looked on Wikipedia. The actual R-7 was a lot shorter: see here 

The whole shebang is just for looks. It probably has MUCH more rocket than needed.﻿

Yeah, I recognised the silver textures from Textures Unlimited. I have 2 tips for your R7.

1. You should make the bottom bit of the first stage (the bit that the boosters go around) 1.25m, as that's what the real R7 (and Soyuz) rockets did. You can switch the Kodiak engine shroud to 1.25m so it fits.

2. Can you switch to the 'white' variant in Textures Unlimited? That'd make your R7 look less like a Titan.

(Yes, I know this is a pic of Vostok but it's the same launch vehicle as Sputnik)

Edited October 6, 2018 by RealKerbal3x

@RealKerbal3x Thanks for the tips...

sorry, but I already have the pics of the mission...
